intro: Arawakia angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arawakia, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is a climbing vine that belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant has slender, opposite leaves that are usually lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small and often clustered, with a distinctive purple or pink coloration. Arawakia angustata plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
